oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LCA of Soybean Meal
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dalgaard, Randi
Schmidt, Jannick
Halberg, Niels
Christensen, Per
Thrane, Mikkel
Pengue, Walter A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm nutrient management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Soybean meal is an important protein input to the European livestock production, with Argentina being an important supplier. The area cultivated with soybeans is still increasing globally, and so are the number of LCAs where the production of soybean meal forms part of the product chain. In recent years there has been increasing focus on how soybean production affects the environment. The purpose of the study was to estimate the environmental consequences of soybean meal consumption using a consequential LCA approach. The functional unit is 'one kg of soybean meal produced in Argentina and delivered to Rotterdam Harbor.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Dalgaard, Randi; Schmidt, Jannick; Halberg, Niels; Christensen, Per; Thrane, Mikkel and Pengue, Walter A. (2007) LCA of Soybean Meal. International Journal of LCA, 15, pp. 1-15.
